Reviews.Title: “No character but spotless and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: timtom79
Reviews.Content: This nondescript chain hotel is clean, reliable, efficient and very reasonably priced as far as Paris hotels go. There even is free (albeit crappy and VPN-blocking) WiFi and a quite decent breakfast included in the room price. The rooms are small but bright and well-insulated. Double communicating rooms are available for families at a special price and there is a diminutive set of computer games for kids in the lobby. The location is not as bad as other reviews would imply: at 3 minutes walk from a line 14 metro and RER stop, it is ideally reachable from Gare de Lyon and very well connected to the RATP network. Rue de Tolbiac is in the 13th arrondissement, near the National Library and the Paris Diderot university, in a neighborhood that has recently been reclaimed from a former rail corridor. The architecture and atmosphere there is quite different than in other parts of the city, more modern and upbeat. At the same time, the 13th arrondissement also houses the largest Asian community in Paris, making it a great place to hang out in the evening, with quirky shops and cheap but excellent dining opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy hotel with responsible staff”
Reviews.Author: Ti_Cheng
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I visited France last Christmas (Dec 2011), we stayed in 2 different hotels during this trip, and we were glad that All Seasons Paris Tolbiac Bibliotheque was one that we selected. The hotel was the former Holiday Inn hotel, rooms were a bit small, but since we are going out most of the time during the day, we only need a room with good shower and nice bed to sleep. The rooms gave me a very welcoming feeling, I totally feel that we were like going home every night after our visit to places. The shower was fantastic, very strong water pressure and I enjoyed the wifi service that provided. As most of the TV channels were in French, our only entertainment at night is to online or browse with our iPad, the wifi service definitely came in handy. I want to highlight 2 of the staffs that work there, one of them is a lady named Dana and another one is a man named Vincent. Both of them made our stay a really pleasent one and they have truly shown to us the real good service hotel can provide. Remember the second day after we checked in, hubby and I were planning to go to Disneyland Paris, and eventhought we have advance booked the tour bus with the previous hotel that we stayed, Dana nonetheless explained the journey and what we will expect during the trip, I find her really care for each of her customers, she even told us to be careful of pickpockets whenever there are a lot of people and be watchful of each other, make sure we take care when we go out. And about Vincent, he is as caring as Dana, always welcome us with a smile and also very courteous, he is never tired of our questions and really take time to explain to us the directions from one place to another. All Seasons Paris Tolbiac Bibliotheque is definitely a cosy little hotel that valued for money! AI will go back there again should we have a chance to visit Paris again! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Clean bedroom and decent breakfast but far away from the main touristy attractions”
Reviews.Author: Maritje
Reviews.Content: I spend two nights there with my boyfriend, our room was OK and the staff was friendly. I would recommend it only if you have a lot of time to spend in Paris as the main attractions (Eiffel Tower, Champs-Elysées, Louvre, etc) are not very close to the hotel (25-30min by subway). All in all, I found more cons than pros. Pros: clean bedroom, decent breakfast (croissant, bread, apples, apricots, fresh orange juice, jam, nutella, cereal, eggs, tea, coffee), very close to the subway (about 2min walking), amenities (LUX soap and also soap bars and shampoo), check out at noon. Cons: expensive parking lot (18 euros per day), the recepcionist that did our check out didn't speak good french nor english, small fridge (a 2l bottle can't fit in there!), far away from the main attractions, the sink of our bathroom was clogged, old magazines available for guests at the reception (I got an "Elle" magazine of 6 months ago!), free WIFI didn't work in our bedroom and the computer downstairs has a very slow internet conection (some websites could not be opened).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great place to stay for Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman1955
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel, which might seem a little out of the way, but it is only 100 meters from the Métro Line 14 Station Bibliothèque. Just buy 10-tickets for EUR 12,70 and off you go - within 10 minutes you are smack in the centre of Paris. The hotel's staff were friendly, English-speaking and very helpful. I had booked a single room, it was located on the 2nd floor on the street side, it was clean, not small at all (small table + chair), I liked the fact that curtains were able to totally darken the room at night, the only disadvantage being the streetnoise in the evening/at night. The room had FREE WiFi, LCD-TV and airconditioning. A bit of a "pain" was the bathroom: taking a shower meant that the whole bathroom went "flooded", as there is only a small glass wall and no curtain - knowing that curtains are difficult to keep clean, a slightly larger glass wall would be much appreciated. Among the positive aspects were the free breakfast menu (croissants, pain au chocolat, baguette + cheese, meat + fruit + marmelade, honey, butter + tea, coffee, milk) where you could make your own FRESH orange juice! and free WiFi. The price for the room was also very competitive, which makes this hotel an absolute great place to stay when visiting Paris (business/pleasure) - I will definitively stay here again for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAMA1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as I was in Paris for work. The hotel was very basic. The good things were the free breakfast (croissants and pain au chocolat) and free wifi. The less positive things were the tiny room which had not been properly cleaned (there was a half-empty bottle of water on my bedside table, used towels in the bathroom and hairs on the bedsheets). The staff were friendly but not particularly courteous - i.e. you could order food to eat in your room but you have to go down to the reception desk and collect it yourself once it's ready. I would recommend that you don't eat in the hotel (except breakfast) I arrived late at night and was very hungry so ordered the lasagne but this was an extremely disappointing microwave meal and completely cold when I collected it from reception. The area around the hotel is fine - I arrived at nighttime and it didn't feel particularly great then but seeing it in the daylight in the morning it seemed alright.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom and Cancellation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Bathroom wasn't to the level of price of this hotel. Tried to cancel the last night; it was already late but the reception told me it is normally 50% of the room cost (acceptable) but when she went to confirm with manager, it was the full amount. Shame!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: x_emily_x_may_x
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I hoped for! It was in an excellent location, all the main attractions were a walkable distance, however if you don't fancy walking the Metro is literally a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Hotel is set on a main road, however it is not noisy at all, didn't notice any road traffic noise once inside hotel. Felt safe walking home to hotel late at night, there are also a few shops, patisseries and restaurants up the road from the hotel. Hotel staff friendly, couldn't have been more helpful showing where the good areas to eat and visit etc. Breakfast also a pleasant experience selection of croissants, fruit, cereal, bread and a decent cup of tea! Also an extra benefit was the hotel underground car park, meant we had somewhere safe to keep the car. Rooms very clean, tidy, bright and very nicely decorated. Would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel is good but I hope have all the times an offer like the first one i got it from the internet because the price is expensive, but the service was good do also because I am student so why you don't have offer for the student?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: MumuGB
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by chance, on the Accor website. For some unknown, I managed to get a night for 39 Euros (it was called the Tuesday's sales). I was a bit worried of what I was going to get for such a price (all other hotels were costing more than 100 Euros...) I was pleasantly surprised. The breakfast was included (and you get fresh orange juice for that..) and Wi-Fi was also included... The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. They reminded me of the Campanile hotel. I understand that the normal price is around 70 Euros, which still makes it very competitive. I will go back -especially if I manage to get the same price!-

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic hotel close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGBG
Reviews.Content: A clean and basic hotel close to the Metro. The rooms are small but have what you need. Free WiFi in the room. Typical french hotel breakfast. A good choice if you want to have a good room for a low cost.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fly234
Reviews.Content: i was there for just one short night it seemed like a cute place. The furnishings gave the place a homey and airy and comfortable look. The service was great- i really like the breakfast menu that they offered. Alltogether it was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “I would do it again.”
Reviews.Author: Philippa_Skoul
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small, however very clean. Not at all cozy or luxurious but satisfying for its price. The biggest problem was that there are no closet and only one of us could unpack the baggages. Also, there was not enough space, we had to walk around one at a time. The breakfast was poor and every day was cold. What's more, one of the days there wasn't enough breakfast for all of us. But it was free, and this is really rare in Paris. The staff was helpful enough. The free Wi-Fi was not running the most of the time. Although, the most important thing was the location. Quiet neiboughrhood and the metro station only 2 min walking distance. You can go everywhere with the metro and RER.

Reviews.Title: “New name, still a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CJIMI
Reviews.Content: Note the name change. This hotel is now called the All Seasons Hotel ( a member of the Accor hotel group). They were changing the logo, on the outside of the hotel, when we stayed there the last few days of August, 2010. When we paid for the room at check out, the credit card receipt still read " Holiday Inn ". We had stayed here a few times in the past, when it was a Holiday Inn, and I liked it then. I still like it. The room was still quiet, clean, and the A/C worked well. you have cable TV in the room, with both BBC & CNN for english speakers. The hotel offers complementary newspapers, the Herald Tribune ( English ) and Le Figaro ( French ). The big change is in the breakfast buffet. It now costs only 6 euros per person, instead of 13. The downside is that they no longer offer bacon, eggs, or potatoes on the buffet table BUT, they now have a machine that makes FRESH SQUEEZED ORANGE JUCE ! What a treat ! From the Roissy-CDG airport, take the train to the St. Michel station, then transfer to the RER C line. Get off at the Bibliotheque Francois Mitterand stop, and then follow the signs to the rue du Tolbiac exit. Although the hotel is not in the center of Paris, the adjacent RER C and/or high speed Metro line No. 14 will take you to most of the sights in 10-15 minutes. Go and enjoy, there is so much to see and do in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: JuliaV_9
Reviews.Content: Average hotel in nice enough area; lots of shops and restaurants around, as well as metro stops. Seine river banks about 10 mins walk away. The rooms are average. Breakfast in the lobby is nice and much cheaper than in the breakfast room. I walked past this month (June 2010) when staying in a different hotel and it looks like they are renovating and closed for guests. Good to keep in mind when booking.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumbaiace
Reviews.Content: locatred near a subway.convenient to visit most paris locations.clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly, not great location but convenient for line 14”
Reviews.Author: Zavya
Reviews.Content: I stay here a lot on business and have never been disatified. The area is not one of Paris' best but it has good links via line 14 (not prone to strike action) to key parts of the city. The staff are friendly and obliging. The rooms are small but clean, comfortable and functional so are fine if you are out all day. Rooms overlooking rue Tolbiac are quiet as long as the windows are closed. Typical buffet breakfast. Evening food served but not really a restaurant. Good value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: All Seasons Paris Tolbiac Bibliotheque de France
HotelInfo.Address: 21, rue de Tolbiac, 75013 Paris, France
